Reviews.Content: Do not even consider It pays to read reviews.In this case we did not and that is a pity,We definitely will not recommend this hotel.Under no circumstances. A third rate hotel and far too expensive even for a third rate hotel. It is in desperate need of some fixes. Everything is in a stage of disrepair. The TV wasn't working, there was no hot water.... and then we were moved to another room which had hot water for one shower only. The bed was standing at an angle, air conditioning?What air conditioning?- the parking surcharge is ridiculous if you take into account that they say parking is provided in the street but do not tell you what happens on nights that the street get washed.It may be on the banks of the river but there are hardly any restaurants close by and the staff do not tell you much about getting the bus to downtown. Staying at this hotel may spoil your experience of Florence.
Reviews.Author: FletcherSandton

Reviews.Content: Eh, It's ok I read all of the reviews and was totally prepared for the worst when we left for Florence. Once we found the bus stop to head to the hotel, we piled onto a crammed bus that stopped about a half mile from our hotel and kicked us all off, i assume, because his shift was over. So my boyfriend and i hauled our suitecases the rest of the way...thank goodness i had printed out a map, or i would have been even MORE pissed off.Once we found the hotel, the older gentleman at the desk helped us, with little to no personality. Our room was VERY basic...a bed, a desk, a lamp, a small TV, a phone that didnt work, a window with a mini balcony, and an OLD A/C unit that was loud and didnt blow out very cold air. We stuck it out...the front desk did make us reservations at a fabulous restaurant. The hotel is a good 25-35 min walk into the main city, but we enjoyed the walk, and stopped at a few stores on the way. So I didnt think it was the 'Worst hotel in Florence', but i think we'll spend the extra bucks to get an air conditioned place in the main city centre next time.
Reviews.Author: dlmpesh

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel Ever This hotel was absolutely the worst I have ever seen. After looking at the room I immediately left and looked for a new hotel. There was mold on the floor and in the shower. The room smelled and had numerous mosquitos. Furthermore, the dust was caked on the lighting fixtures and there was an 8 month expired candy bar in the mini fridge. The receptionist at the other hotel I checked into said the Da Verrazano is the worst hotel in all of Florence/Firenze.
Reviews.Author: kpsmithlaw20

Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of the worst places in Florence This place was horrible. The hot water did not work in our room, and the management kept giving us a run around as to when it would be fixed. We stayed there three days, and no one had come to fix it. They also refused to move us to another room until the last night, six hours before we were to check out. The staff is extremely rude and defensive when we asked them to fix the water problem. The breakfast was a joke, as you had to practically beg for something simple as a croissant. They claim they are very close to the city centre, the walk is nearly 45 minutes, not the 20min they claim. It is definitely not as advertised, very dirty, and the A/C kept shutting off, as it was controlled by the lobby. I would never recommend this hotel for anyone.
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler1

Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here!!!! Where do I start... advertised with airconditing which is ancient and doesn't work, this hotel is disgusting. The breakfast was a joke, very bad biscuits and cordial basically. The bathroom was very old and filthy, the window security shutters did not close, I could go on and on, oh and it is at least 40 minutes walk to the centre not 20 minutes like the advertising says. I never write bad reviews but I felt I needed to warn others not to make the same mistake I did. Just do yourself a huge favour and don't stay at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Value for Short Visit       Eileen  Sheila @ Reception
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ok for a quick stay Comfortable and convenient for my purposes - one night and breakfast. Quite suitable. My room was clean and comfortable. Sheila on reception very welcoming. Loved Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid like the plague I have to say, I was incredibly shocked that this was rated as a 3* hotel after we arrived. My boyfriend and I had booked this hotel after the company we booked with said it would be a room with a river view, but it wasn't even on the river, and our view was of the building across the road! It was an incredibly noisy hotel, and we could hear people tramping up and down stairs all night, and a toilet flushing sounded like a monsoon! The room was not particularly clean either. We ended up staying for just one night, and moved to the much nicer Hotel Silla a mile down the road on the other side of the river. Now that hotel I would recommend to everyone, but anyone actually wanting to enjoy their trip to Florence should avoid Da Verrazzano like the plague. I agree with everyone who has termed it a 'youth hostel'. Horrid.
Reviews.Author: little_miss_pink

Reviews.Content: Bad Location for Walkers The location of this hotel was pretty awful for me, as someone relying on public transportation and walking to get around. I tried to take a bus from the train station to this hotel but got desperately lost and had to walk back to town (the bus station had absolutely no maps available to show where the bus was going, and the bus doesn't actually stop on the same road as the hotel, but a couple blocks away). After that negative experience, I walked into town, a long  hot 35 minutes each way. Another problem was the check-in time of 4 pm, very late in my opinion-- it felt like forever waiting for my room to be ready. The room itself wasn't too bad, and even had a tiny balcony, with a teeny tiny patch of the arno river visible-- but I wouldn't call it a good view and a balcony too small for a chair doesn't make the hotel worth staying at.
Reviews.Author: lovriena

Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel Avoid this hotel if you can. We were booked there for one night and probably the worst night in our three week long Europe trip. The room was fairly big compared to other hotels in Europe but like the previous reviewers mentioned, there was no A/C. I was up almost two hours in the night since the A/C was simply blowing hot air. When we called hotel reception, a guy came rubbing his eyes, said that yes, there is a problem and walked away. Next day, while checking out (relieved to leave) the lady at the reception mentioned that many people had complained about this the A/C and they will fix it soon!! The hotel is not close to any restaurant, or bus stop and there is no river view. The staff is polite but does not seem to care for guests ..The hotel round the corner seems much more attractive..All in all, pay a little more and stay in a hotel with better reviews..or if you can't get your own fan!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid this Hotel The Hotel da Verrazzano in Florence, Italy is listed as a 3 star hotel but it is more like a backpackers hostel. It is in a nice area, close to the banks of the Arno, but it is a very sub standard property. The air conditioning in our room did not work and had not for some time, judging by the amount of dust and old bits of paper in the the ancient airconditoning unit's air grille. The bathroom was very, very small with hardly any room to move, in fact it was almost impossible to sit on the toilet comfortably without your knees jammed against the wall in front of you. The shower cubicle had mould on the tiles and the toilet bowl was badly stained. One of the bedside lamps did not work, the refrigeration unit in the mini bar did not work, the bedroom floor was dusty and dirty and the edge of the balcony floor was crumbling away. The hotel did not have a fire escape. The breakfast, which was served in a dingy and rather smelly basement room, was very poor. There was very little choice of food and the one tray of meat and cheese was sweating in direct sunlight. The coffee and water for tea was almost cold and there were small flies crawling on the buffet table. We were booked in for 4 nights but checked out after one night and moved to another 3 star hotel around the corner which was far, far superior and only 20 euros a night more. I would recommend that you stay well clear of the Hotel da Verrazzano.
Reviews.Author: Eurofile

Reviews.Content: Not a great place to stay... My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. It was the worst of the hotels we had stayed at during our 13 day trip in Italy. The place screamed to be renovated! The rooms smelled of cheap air freshner. Tour groups of young kids staying at the hotel screamed for hours. I would definitely say it's more on the youth hostel level. Location was far from city center. Bus stop was not far from hotel but made traveling into the center stressful. You could also hear the traffic most of the night from the busy road that runs along the river. Positives: large room, friendly  helpful staff, tables in front of hotel to sit and have a drink.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid this place ! The hotel was rated as 3 stars but it is more like a youth hostel. The booking voucher said 'room with a river view' but the hotel was a block away from the river and our room overlooked the street. The rooms were shabby with missing handles on cupboards etc. The hotel was extremely noisy with poor sound insulation - we were woken by noisy German teenagers at 2:30am on our first night and 3:30am on our second night. The location is far from the city centre - and the bus stops are not as close to the hotel as the hotel web-site suggests.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
